frame.name: Toxic_substance
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Toxic_substance</fen> causes death or harm when introduced into or absorbed by a living organism, the <fen>Victim</fen>. The <fen>Toxic_substance</fen> may be specified to be produced by or contained in a <fen>Toxin_source</fen>. The <fen>Toxic_substance</fen> may affect the <fen>Victim</fen> as a whole or a particular <fen>Body_part</fen> (understood here to include organs and other sub-systems). A <fen>Degree</fen> of harmfulness can be specified and the <fen>Toxic_substance</fen> may develop its effect only under particular <fen>Circumstances</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Toxic_substance">The main product , sulphide ,</fex> <m>is</m> <t>toxic</t> <fex name="Body_part">to cells</fex> </ex>
<ex><fex name="Toxic_substance">They</fex> are better tolerated and <m>are</m> <fex name="Degree">less</fex> <t>toxic</t> <fex name="con">in overdose</fex></ex>
<ex>The reason he was close to danger was because an extremely <t>poisonous</t> <fex name="toxs">beetle</fex> was crawling down his shoulder.</ex>
<ex><fex name="tox">Ingested gliadin and PT-gliadin</fex> <m>are</m> <t>toxic</t> <fex name="vic">to coeliac patients</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Victim
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Victim</fen> is the being or entity that is capable of being harmed by the <fen>Toxic_substance</fen>.
<ex>Chocolate can be <t>poisonous</t> <fex name="vic">for some types of pets</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Degree</fen> is the degree to which the <fen>Toxic_substance</fen> is harmful to the <fen>Victim</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Body_part
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Body_part</fen> defines the part of the <fen>Victim</fen>'s body that is harmed.
<ex>This vitamin taken in excess could <m>be</m> <t>poisonous</t> <fex name="bod">for the liver</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>A fact or action that explains why the <fen>Toxic_substance</fen> has a harmful effect on the <fen>Victim</fen> .</def-root>

FE.name: Toxic_substance
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate the substance which potentially causes harm to a <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex>Highly <t>toxic</t> <fex name="tox">pollutants</fex> could be safely disposed of by burning them</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>A set of circumstances, often the relative amount of the <fen>Toxic_substance</fen> that is present, under which the <fen>Toxic_substance</fen> is specified to have or lack a toxic effect.
<ex>Some metals, such as copper and selenium, are essential to normal metabolic function as trace elements but are <t>toxic</t> <fex name="con">at high levels of exposure</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Toxin_source
FE.definition:
<def-root>A living organism, object or process that produces a <fen>Toxic_substance</fen>.
<ex>A young man was bitten by a <t>poisonous</t> <fex name="toxs">snake</fex> and lives to tell about it.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Type</fen> identifies the kind or sort of <fen>Toxic_substance</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>Temporal period for which the substance or source remains toxic to the victim.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: poison.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a substance that causes death or harm when introduced into or absorbed by a living organism.

lexUnit.name: poisonous.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: producing or of the nature of poison

lexUnit.name: venom.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: poisonous fluid secreted by animals such as snakes and scorpions and typically injected into prey or aggressors by biting or stinging

lexUnit.name: venomous.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: secreting or capable of injecting venom.
